item.title: Emacs syntax checking with Flycheck
item.description: Flycheck is a syntax checker for Emacs. Confusingly there’s another syntax checker called Flymake that is built into Emacs. Flycheck seems to have vastly more functionality though. Essentially what Flycheck does is shows you “errors” for the buffer that you’re editing. Errors are context dependent. In a Ruby file it might be a syntax error. In a blog post, it might be a syntax error. There’s a comparison table between Flycheck and Flymake here.

item.title: How to remove stale github workflows
item.description: There’s a long standing Github ticket for removing stale github workflows. Turns out there’s no way to remove a workflow. The work around here is to remove all workflow runs first. Install github command line tool: brew install gh In the repo’s working directory do the following: 1 gh run list --workflow=stale-workflow.yml --json databaseId | jq '.[].databaseId' | xargs -I{} gh run delete {} Replace stale-workflow.yml with the appropriate workflow file name.

item.title: readme-toc - generate a table of contents in markdown documents
item.description: readme-toc is a utility that creates a table of contents in markdown documents.
